author: Special Correspondent
text:
The Indian Development Foundation in collaboration with Gremaltes Hospital organised a tuberculosis (TB) awareness rally on Marina Beach on Thursday, to commemorate World TB Day. According to a press release, Mervin Alexander, postmaster general, Chennai Post, flagged off the rally from the Light House. Nearly 500 volunteers and students took part in the rally to spread awareness about tuberculosis.

Pius Kalathil, director, Gremaltes Hospital spoke about importance of early detection and the dangers of drug-resistant TB.

S. Sreeram, manager, Indian Development Foundation, said India accounted for 23 per cent of global TB cases and most deaths — 2,20,000 in 2014.

He added that treatment for TB is free in all government clinics and hospitals and stressed the importance of adhering to treatment.

Scouts and guides from various schools, nursing students, college students, doctors, paramedics and volunteers took part in the rally.
title: Awareness rally held on Marina
